articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Venezuelan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Venezuelan President 
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Hugo Chavez Frias, president of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, on the occasion of its bicentennial independence day.
					 Kim in the message said he was pleased with the great successes made by the friendly Venezuelan people in firmly defending their independence and sovereignty and building a just society for the working masses under his leadership. 
					
					 He, at the same time, extended full support and solidarity to the initiatives and efforts of the Venezuelan government for regional integration and independent development.
					
					He heartily hoped that the President would enjoy good health and register greater success in his work for the country's prosperity and the people's well-being, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two peoples would continue to favorably develop in the future, too, on the road of independence against imperialism and for socialism.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chu Greets Venezuelan FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chu Greets Venezuelan FM
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Friday sent a message of greeting to Nicolas Maduro Moros, foreign minister of People's Power of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, on its bicentennial independence day.
					 The message said that Venezuelan people are now significantly celebrating the bicentennial independence day after making achievements in the struggle to protect the sovereignty and peace of the country and build a just society for the working masses in recent years under the leadership of President Hugo Chavez Frias. 
					
					 It wished the Venezuelan foreign minister greater success in his work, expressing belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two peoples would grow stronger with each passing day in the struggle for independence against imperialism and for global peace.

articles.title: Greetings to Rwandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Rwandan President
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Paul Kagame, president of Rwanda,  on its national day.
					 Kim in his message heartily wished Paul Kagame success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the favorably developing bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Cape Verde
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cape Verde
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Pedro Pirez, president of the Republic of Cape Verde, on its 36th anniversary of Independence and the proclamation of the Republic.
					Kim in the message wished the President great success in his work for the socio-economic development of the country and the national prosperity, expressing belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Pyongyang City Army-People Rally Held
articles.content:
Pyongyang City Army-People Rally Held
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang city army-people rally took place at Kim Il Sung Square on Monday in denunciation of the crimes committed by the Lee Myung Bak group of unparalleled traitors.
					The rally was attended by senior party, state and army officials, chairperson of a friendly party, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, public organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials in the fields of science, education, culture and arts, public health and media, working people and students in the city, more than 100,000 in all.
					
					 A statement of a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army was read out at the rally to be followed by speeches.
					
					 KPA General Jang Jong Nam said on behalf of the servicepersons of the KPA: Now that south Korean confrontation maniacs without equals in the world dared to perpetrate such extreme provocation as not ruling out even a war against the DPRK, there remains between the north and the south only physical settlement of returning fire for fire. 
					
					 The powerful revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu has never made an empty talk. It is the spirit and courage of the KPA to deal merciless deadly blows at the enemies till they are wiped out to the last man.
					
					 Those who do harm to the dignity of our leadership will not be able to go scot-free on this land and in the sky, he warned.
					
					  Representative of youth and students Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Youth League, said that the reckless confrontation campaign kicked off by traitor Lee and the military hooligans is stunning the world. He vehemently condemned the Lee group of traitors, the sworn enemy of the nation, on behalf of the five million youth and students.
					
					 He called upon all the young people to mercilessly wipe out the group and achieve the cause of the country's reunification without fail in a nationwide sacred retaliatory war as befitting a reserve combat unit and detached force of the Supreme Commander.
					
					 Representative of workers Kim Ho Chol, head of a pit of the Hukryong Coal Mine, said that the hearts of the workers of the DPRK are burning with the towering resentment and anger at the puppet group keen in escalating the confrontation with the DPRK bereft of reason and discretion, and filled with the determination to take revenge upon it.
					
					 He declared that the workers would effect a surge in production in all fields of national economy and thus decisively foil the group's reckless racket for confrontation with the DPRK. 
					
					 Representative of agricultural workers Kim Yong Bok, chairperson of the Management Board of the Mangyongdae Vegetable Farm, Mangyongdae District, said: It is as clear as a pikestaff that the nation will suffer greatest disaster if the above-said group is not punished. The agricultural workers will stand guard over the socialist rural position, each holding a rifle in one hand and a sickle in the other and bring about a decisive turn in the agricultural production in the spirit of dealing sledge-hammer blows at the Lee group.

articles.title: Gazprom Delegation of Russia Arrives
articles.content:
Gazprom Delegation of Russia Arrives
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Gazprom of Russia led by Deputy Managing Chairman Alexandr Ananenkov arrived here Monday.

articles.title: DPRK to Contribute to World Food Security
articles.content:
DPRK to Contribute to World Food Security
Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government will as ever intensify the cooperation with the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organizations (FAO) and all its member nations, in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, the basis of the DPRK's foreign policy, and positively contribute to the worldwide efforts for global food security.
					 The head of the DPRK delegation expressed this stand in his speech at the 37th Meeting of the FAO Conference on June 29.
					
					 He gave appreciation of achievements made by the FAO in its work for global food security and multilateral development of agriculture over the past years and of its leadership ability displayed to effectively meet the challenges threatening the existence of mankind.
					
					 Referring to the food crisis caused by natural disasters sweeping over the world, sharp rise of food and oil prices, increased bio-fuel production, etc., he said that the situation calls for more active measures to intensify the FAO's activities for global food security.
					
					 The FAO should pay attention to providing favorable international environment so that socio-economic conditions are ensured to increase the agricultural output in developing countries, he said, adding: It is necessary for the organization to take measures to help its member nations adopt agricultural strategy and policy suited to their specific conditions and raise their agricultural productivity.
					
					 The DPRK defined agriculture as the lifeline for improving the standard of people's living and is concentrating all nationwide efforts on it, he noted, saying:
					
					 The DPRK's efforts for economic construction will be helpful to the world economic development and food security. It will also be significantly conducive to the efforts of the international community for implementing the UN Millennium Development Goals and the action program of the world food security summit.

articles.title: DPRK's Taekwon-Do Demonstration Group Successfully Performs in US
articles.content:
DPRK's Taekwon-Do Demonstration Group Successfully Performs in US
Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Taekwon-Do, orthodox martial art of the Korean nation now widely disseminated worldwide, created a great sensation in the United States again. 
					The DPRK's Taekwon-Do Demonstration Group had performed in the U.S., drawing capacity spectators since June 9, touring three cities in the east part of the U.S. including New York for a week.
					
					This was the second visit by the group since 2007. The recent visit drew world attention as it took place at a time when the DPRK is boosting international exchange and cooperation while accelerating the building of a thriving socialist nation under the banner of independence, peace and friendship.
					
					Media of the U.S. and many other countries including China paid attention to its visit to the U.S. even before its start from Pyongyang. They gave wide coverage to the whole course of its visit from its arrival in the U.S., its performances and return home. 
					
					Great were the expectations of Americans for the visit of the DPRK's sports mission to the U.S. as it would bring close feelings of the two peoples while demonstrating the spirit of the Taekwon-Do, the pride of the Korean nation and a world famous martial art. 
					
					The venues of performances were crowded with Taekwon-Do fans, citizens and Koreans from different parts of the country. The DPRK's national flag was seen hoisted there and streamers reading "Goodwill visit of the DPRK's Taekwon-Do Demonstration Group-2011" and "DPRK-U.S. Reconciliation, Friendship, Peace" were displayed.
					
					The DPRK Taekwon-Do players fully demonstrated the wisdom and high spirit of the Korean nation and power of the orthodox martial art from its premiere in Boston City, Massachusetts State. It gave just three performances, evoking a lively response in the U.S.
					
					Their presentations were made amidst the playing of the DPRK's national anthem while its national flag was hoisted. They successfully performed different numbers including Taekwon-Do exercise for health with high martial art skills, winning high acclaims from spectators. 
					
					Whenever they presented such refined technical movements showcasing breath-taking yet strong power as destroying bricks and others, kicking targets by turning back and the art of self-defense, all spectators stood up and sent enthusiastic applauses to them.
					
					Even after performances were over, many spectators kept clapping their hands. Some of them called on the players, congratulating them on their successes. They also took pictures together. Many spectators vied with each other to get signatures from players, reluctant to part from them.
					
					Spectators were unanimous in describing "Taekwon-Do of the DPRK as the best and mysterious martial art." The demonstration performances provided us with an opportunity to know about the strong mental power of the DPRK admired by the world, they added.
					
					Koreans in the U.S. had this to say: We were encouraged to watch the powerful Taekwon-Do replete with national spirit and soul. We feel proud of being Koreans whose ancestors founded Taekwon-Do.
					
					The DPRK Taekwon-Do players not only displayed indomitable spirit and grit and high technique they have trained in day-to-day trainings but also showcased noble spiritual and moral traits, moving spectators.
					
					When interviewed by media persons who congratulated the players on their successes, they told they performed with the pluck and grit instilled into them by leader Kim Jong Il. Americans were greatly impressed to hear that.
					
					Many of those who met DPRK players looked surprised to hear about the Korean people's absolute trust in their leader and ardent reverence for him at first but they expressed sympathy and understanding of the source of the mental power of the DPRK later.
					
					During its stay in the U.S. the demonstration group taught Taekwon-Do to students in different cities, deeply impressing Americans.
					
					An American journalist who accompanied the group said:
					
					Taekwon-Do is becoming more popular than Karate, Kung fu and other martial arts as it helps train both physical bodies and minds.
					
					Many parents in the U.S. teach Taekwon-Do to their children because it puts more emphasis on the spirit and personal character than any other martial arts. They expect to see their children cultivate through Taekwon-Do patience and concentration, good-mannered behavior, respect for elders, responsibility for themselves and ability to keep away from liquor and smoking.
					
					The U.S. and world media gave wide publicity to the performances by the DPRK's Taekwon-Do demonstration group every day.
					
					Not only the CNN and other broadcasting services and newspapers of the U.S., the newspapers of Koreans in the U.S., Internet media, the Chinese Central TV, Nihon TV of Japan but south Korean media including KBS and MBC highlighted the group's performance and sojourn.
					
					VOA gave special reports about the DPRK's Taekwon-Do demonstration group almost every day.
					
					The U.S. media said Americans who were looking at the DPRK Taekwon-doists with curiosity got mingled with them, following their movements.
					
					American politicians sent congratulatory letters on the successes gained by the DPRK's Taekwon-Do demonstration group and its significance.
					
					The chairman of the U.S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee said this year's cultural exchange would be helpful to promoting reconciliation, friendship and peace between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					A congressman from New Jersey State said the DPRK's Taekwon-Do demonstration group's performances would help the Americans and the Koreans establish relations based on mutual understanding, adding he welcomes such an exchange.
					
					A mayor of a city, New Jersey State in a letter congratulating the DPRK Taekwon-doists on their successful visit to the U.S. noted with appreciation that the Taekwon-Do technique of the DPRK is quite different from what he has seen in the U.S. The amazing oneness in the movement of the DPRK Taekwon-Do players is a technique distinguished in martial art, he added, emphasizing the demonstration group helped the two peoples get closer with each other.
					
					The president of the Senate and the speaker of the House of Representatives of New Jersey State in a letter signed by them said the DPRK Taekwon-doists are respected and admired by Americans for their gifted skills, high level of techniques and positive efforts. They congratulated the players on their successful performances.
					
					American citizens earnestly requested the DPRK's Taekwon-Do demonstration group to visit other local areas of the U.S., asking the players to come to the U.S. again.
					
					The DPRK Taekwon-doists replied they would come again if they are given more opportunity to demonstrate the DPRK's Taekwon-Do in the U.S.
					
					The DPRK Taekwon-doists' performances in the U.S. excited Americans and left deep impression on them.

articles.title: DPRK Weightlifters Bag 8 Medals at World Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Weightlifters Bag 8 Medals at World Championships 
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK weightlifters won 2 gold medals, 5 silvers and 1 bronze at the 2011 Junior World Weightlifting Championships in Malaysia. 
					 Om Yun Chol jerked 156 kg in men's 56 kg category while Rim Jong Sim 128 kg in women's 63 kg category, placing first. 
					
					 Choe Hyo Sim came second in women's 53 kg category total with 89kg snatch and 108 kg jerk, bagging three silver medals. Jo Bok Hyang also finished second in women's 58 kg category total with 122 kg jerk, winning two silver medals.  
					
					 Rim Jong Sim won a bronze medal in total. 
					
					 The championships brought together at least 280 weightlifters from more than 50 countries and regions including China, Russia and Italy.

articles.title: Insulator Moulding Process Put on CNC Basis
articles.content:
Insulator Moulding Process Put on CNC Basis
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The Kyongsong Insulator Factory in the northern part of Korea has put its insulator moulding process on a CNC (computer numerical control) to improve the quality of the products. 
					 The factory, with a 60-odd-year-long history, produces various kinds of insulators to suit international standards.
					
					 The factory, located in North Hamgyong Province abundant in raw materials of insulator, has good road, railway and marine transport conditions. It, close to the areas sharing borders with China and Russia, has strengthened cooperation with foreign businesses.

articles.title: New Scientific Films Come Out
articles.content:
New Scientific Films Come Out
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The Korean Documentary and Science Film Studio recently released new films of significance in wedding science and technology to production. 
					 They are "Effect of Undersea Mineral Matters" and "Water Jet Loom".
					
					 The first film explains the reason why sea has many mineral matters, a method of obtaining mineral matter additives from the sea and their effect on human body, animals, plants and soil.
					
					 It is based on research findings, including the development of a production method of mineral matter additives.
					
					 The next film introduces water jet loom that produces less dust and noise but is high in productivity.

articles.title: Shaved Ice Enjoys Popularity in Summer
articles.content:
Shaved Ice Enjoys Popularity in Summer
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Shaved ice stalls in streets of Pyongyang attract many passers-by in summer days. 
					 They serve shaved ice with boiled red bean, tomato, strawberry and other fruit juice.
					
					 Some people take shaved ice along with Eskimo pie and bread.
					
					 Kim Sun Hui, a 56-year-old woman living in Taedonggang District, told KCNA that shaved ice is the best to take outdoors in sultry days and that she favors shaved ice with boiled red bean.
					
					 Shaved ice stalls add to the summer view of streets in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Ball Rolling, Korean Folk Game
articles.content:
Ball Rolling, Korean Folk Game
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Ball rolling is one of the Korean children's favorite folk games.
					 There are two methods in playing the game. One is to roll a ceramic, glass or iron ball into holes on the ground.
					
					 When a player rolls the ball into a hole, he or she pulls it out of the hole and rolls it to other hole.
					
					 When a player fails to roll the ball into a hole, the next move is another player's.
					
					 Before the start of the game, the players decide the number of the round.
					
					 Another method is to throw a ball to hit other's ball.
					
					 If a player hits other's ball, he or she wins it. The winner will be a player who won more balls.

articles.title: Joint Statement Produced by Kim Il Sung's Patriotism
articles.content:
Joint Statement Produced by Kim Il Sung's Patriotism
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- On July 4, Juche 61 (1972), the north and south of Korea released a historic joint statement, the keynote of which is the three principles of national reunification -- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity.
					 The statement provided the Korean people with guidelines for achieving national reunification independently and peacefully on the basis of great national unity.
					
					 The Korean people owe the joint statement to President Kim Il Sung's strong sense of patriotism and outstanding leadership.
					
					 In the early 1970s, their desire for the country's reunification was running high and the situation at home and abroad was turning in favor of the reunification.
					
					 With a deep insight into the development, the President set forth a new proposal for the country's reunification at the 5th Session of the 4th Supreme People's Assembly in April 1971.
					
					 The eight-point proposal include a free general election involving both sides of Korea, establishment of a unified and democratic central government, introduction of federation as a transitional measure, start of mutual cooperation and traveling and convocation of a north-south political consultative meeting.
					
					 On August 6, 1971, addressing a meeting of Pyongyangites held in honor of a visiting foreign state leader, the President expressed the willingness of the north to contact any south Korean political parties, including the Democratic Republic Party, and public organizations, as well as individuals.
					
					 From the next month onward, multi-channeled contacts and dialogue had taken place between the north and the south for the first time since the division of the country, which eventually led to the adoption of the historic July 4 joint statement.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (1)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (1)
Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The Korean people form a harmonious family with their General Secretary Kim Jong Il, looking up to him as their father and leading a worthwhile life of dedication to him.
					 During the arduous march Kim Jong Il held up the banner of the Songun revolution, believing in the army and people. He is now arousing them with loving care and trust to glorify socialist Korea, heritage bequeathed down by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 A number of ordinary Koreans including soldiers, workers, farmers, scientists, artistes and children whom he met during his forced march of field guidance work for the leader, party and the country, blessed by him.
					
					 Kamnamu (persimmon) company is well known as a women's coast artillery company always remembered by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In February, Juche 84 (1995) he visited the company despite the strong sea wind. He showed fatherly loving care for company commander Choe Myong Ok, company political instructor Ri Yong Wol and all other women soldiers of the company.
					
					 His field guidance produced such a moving story as "Coast Artillerywomen and Medicated Cream". Another touching story that he kept his promise to come back when persimmons were ripen is conveyed till today.
					
					 Even after they were discharged from the military service those women soldiers fulfilled their duty and obligation to live up to the leader's trust and loving care.
					
					 The then commander became an official of a power institute and now an official of the party committee of the Changgwang Health Complex, the country's leading cultural and public service center, while the then political instructor an official of the party committee of the Scientists' Hotel after being schooled at a party cadre training institute.
					
					 The women soldiers who spent their military life under the loving care of the leader are now leading a worthwhile life as officials of important units in the society.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Action against Rev. Han Sang Ryol under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Action against Rev. Han Sang Ryol under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean fascist elements sentenced Rev. Han Sang Ryol to three-years in jail and the same term of suspension of qualification at a trial staged by the Seoul High Court of south Korea again.
					 The court took this action against him after accusing him of fully supporting and praising the DPRK's Songun politics, charging that what he did was "a real danger which might substantially affect" the existence and security" of south Korea.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					  This action was a serious human rights abuse as it was a wanton infringement upon human freedom, rights and conscience and a brutal fascist action taken by traitors against pro-reunification patriotic forces. 
					
					 Rev. Han dedicated himself to the cause of national reunification. This, therefore, can never be incriminated as it should be praised by the whole nation as a patriotic deed.
					
					 The group of Lee Myung Bak has brought to total collapse the inter-Korean relations which had developed favorably, and made the dark clouds of a nuclear war hang over this land, while remaining extremely hostile to fellow countrymen. The court should have judged this group, first of all. 
					
					 Had this group not pushed the inter-Korean relations to such serious catastrophe, opposed to the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, Rev. Han would not have made such trip even risking his life.
					
					 The above-said court decision is not suppression of a single man but a challenge to the DPRK and all Koreans struggling for national reunification, the commentary notes, demanding the south Korean puppet authorities to immediately retract the punishment and set him free unconditionally.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Three Principles of National Reunification
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Three Principles of National Reunification 
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The three principles of national reunification--independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity--clarified in the July 4 joint statement serve as a great programme of reunification common to the nation as they reflect the independent desire and wishes of the Koreans and indicate the most correct way of achieving national reunification. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Thanks to the outstanding and tested leadership of President Kim Il Sung high-level political talks took place between the north and the south of Korea and they culminated in the publication of the July 4 joint statement on July 4, Juche 61 (1972) whose keynote is the three principles of national reunification. 
					
					 The principles have been fully supported by the fellow countrymen as a great programme common to the nation for several decades and powerfully demonstrated their validity and vitality. 
					
					 The historic June 15 joint declaration and its action program October 4 declaration, results of Kim Jong Il's noble patriotic intention and energetic leadership, are strictly based on the above-said principles.
					
					 The said declarations brought about signal achievements in the inter-Korean relations and the movement for national reunification. 
					
					 The history and present reality prove that the above-said principles alone serve as the most just and realistic programme of struggle common to the nation reflecting the desire of the Koreans for reunification and the requirements for the development of the reunification movement in Korea and they are a fundamental cornerstone for national reunification which all Koreans should always hold aloft and the adherence to them is the main orientation for the development of the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					  The above-said principles will always remain vital and the struggle of the Korean nation for accomplishing the June 15 cause is sure to triumph, concludes the article.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Organizations in Bangladesh issued bulletins to commemorate the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee in its bulletin on June 28 carried an article titled "Lifetime for the People", which said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung defeated the two imperialisms in one generation, built a socialist power and provided the people only with pleasure and happiness while undergoing all sorts of hardships.
					
					 To build a country where the people become masters of the state and they lead a happy life with nothing to envy--this was the motto he had maintained in his lifetime to build a powerful country.
					
					 The DPRK made a history of victory and glory along the road of Juche opened by the President and is now greeting the great heyday of prosperity under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy on June 29 carried in its bulletin an article titled "Undying Feats for National Reunification".
					
					 The bulletin noted that the President worked heart and soul for national unity and reunification until the last moments of his life. It also elaborated on the fact that Kim Jong Il opened a new phase for the independent reunification of the country by wisely leading the drive to implement the President's instructions for national reunification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Successful China Visit Hailed Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Successful China Visit Hailed Abroad
						
Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Songchit Pullarp, chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, made public a statement on June 29 in celebration of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's successful visit to China.
					 The statement said: 
					
					 His historic China visit marked an epoch-making event in consolidating the traditional DPRK-China friendly relations and made a great contribution to boosting the friendship, unity and solidarity among the countries desirous of independence and ensuring peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand warmly congratulates Kim Jong Il on his successful visit to China and extends firm solidarity to the Korean people working hard to build a thriving nation.
					
					 Only victory and glory will always be in store for the Korean people in the efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation as they are wisely led by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Ecuador
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Ecuador
Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People on June 25 brought out in e-book General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					 The work, published on August 4, Juche 86 (1997), deals with President Kim Il Sung's undying feats for national reunification.
					
					 It formulates the three principles for national reunification, 10-point programme for the great unity of the entire nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo advanced by him as the three charters for national reunification. It also sets forth the tasks and ways for realizing the cause of national reunification on the basis of the charters.

articles.title: Juche Idea Seminar Held in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Juche Idea Seminar Held in Democratic Congo
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A national seminar on the subject of "President Kim Il Sung and the Juche Idea" took place at University of Kinshasa, Democratic Congo on June 27.
					 Displayed in its venue were photos on the immortal exploits of the peerlessly great persons and books introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Attending the seminar were chiefs and members of Juche idea study organizations of Democratic Congo and teachers and students of the university. The organizations included the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Group for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea, the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of University of Kinshasa, the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of the Working Citizens' Association and the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Kinshasa.
					
					 A report and speeches were made at the seminar in the wake of an opening address by Kamwiziku Octave, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 The reporter and speakers noted that Kim Il Sung founded the man-centered Juche idea and successfully embodied it in the revolution and construction, thus providing the Korean people and the world progressives with the most precious ideo-theoretical wealth.
					
					 Korean-style socialism is characterized by the single-minded unity of the leader, party and masses and the fact that the whole country has turned into a big harmonious family and the Juche character and national character have been thoroughly preserved, they stressed.
					
					 They said that the validity and vitality of the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung have been firmly guaranteed and more strikingly demonstrated thanks to the Songun politics of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The centenary of birth of the President is a holiday common to the progressive people the world over, to say nothing of the Korean people, they said, stressing the need to intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea and the activities for solidarity with the Korean people so as to significantly greet the world conference on the Juche idea.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Mexican President Urges Unity in Crime Fight
articles.content:
Mexican President Urges Unity in Crime Fight
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Mexican President Felipe Calderon on Thursday called for unity in the nation's fight against crimes.
					 "We want to reduce violent robberies, extortion and kidnappings that continue being one of the most serious crimes that aggravates and worries our society," he said.
					
					 Calling upon all the people to unite in the struggle to prevent such criminal acts, the president urged the governors to better address social needs such as education and employment, which, he said, would help prevent young people from committing crimes.

articles.title: Equatorial Guinean President Calls for Unity of African Countries
articles.content:
Equatorial Guinean President Calls for Unity of African Countries
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Equatorial Guinean President Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, speaking at an opening ceremony of the AU summit on June 30, said the continent should remain united and desist from any intervention and pressures of foreign forces.
					 The Western countries are so imprudent as to interfere in the continental issues and interrupt the development of African countries, he charged.
					
					 He called upon the continental countries to unite more firmly to settle all the problems by themselves.

articles.title: Ecuadorian President Calls for End of US Blockade against Cuba
articles.content:
Ecuadorian President Calls for End of US Blockade against Cuba 
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- President of Ecuador Rafael Correa called for putting an end to the U.S. economic, commercial and financial blockade against Cuba, describing it as an insult to international law. 
					 In an interview with Prensa Latina on June 29, Correa said that this action applied for over 50 years against Cuba is another example of international double standards and is unjustifiable at this time in the history of the human race.
					
					 Slandering Cuba is an expression of the hypocritical imperialist arrogance, Correa noted.

articles.title: US Nuclear Power Facilities Get in Danger due to Flood and Wildfire
articles.content:
US Nuclear Power Facilities Get in Danger due to Flood and Wildfire
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Nuclear power facilities are getting in danger in the United States due to the recent flood and wildfire.
					 Downpours left the dike of the Missouri River destroyed to inundate a nuclear power plant near the river, filling water within its building which houses turbines.
					
					 Another nuclear power plant about 130 km south of it along the river is posed to threat by flood.
					
					 Meanwhile, wildfire in New Mexico State reportedly poses threat to the closed Los Alamos nuclear laboratory, giving out smoke over its vicinity.

articles.title: Unemployment in US and Economic Stagnation in Japan, Ireland
articles.content:
Unemployment in US and Economic Stagnation in Japan, Ireland
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- U.S. jobless claims remain at relatively high level.
					 The Labor Department said Thursday that the advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits was 428,000 in the week ending June 25.
					
					 Japan's auto production dropped 30.9 percent in May from a year earlier, Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association said Thursday.
					
					 Ireland's building and construction production fell by 11.4 percent in the first quarter of 2011. Building and construction also saw a significant decline of 23 percent compared with the first quarter of 2010.

articles.title: Trans-Sea Bridge and Sea-bed Tunnel Open to Traffic in China
articles.content:
Trans-Sea Bridge and Sea-bed Tunnel Open to Traffic in China
						
 Beijing, July 3 (KCNA) -- The sea-crossing Jiaozhou Wan Large Bridge and the sea-bed Jiaozhou Wan Tunnel opened to traffic in Qingdao, Shandong Province, China on June 30.
					 The bridge is 36.48 km, the longest in the world and the tunnel 9.47 km, the longest in China, a report said.
					
					 The project for the bridge started in May 2007. It took about four years to complete the tunnel.

articles.title: Cuba Says Legalizing Marihuana Would Be "Historical Irresponsibility"
articles.content:
Cuba Says Legalizing Marihuana Would Be "Historical Irresponsibility"
 Havana, July 3 (KCNA) -- Efforts by some political sectors in a number of Western countries to decriminalize marihuana would be a "historical irresponsibility" that could lead to "irreparable harm" in the society, the National Drug Commission of Cuba said on Friday.
					 The secretary of the commission was responding to a question from reporters about the current debate in the U.S. on a bill that seeks to legalize marijuana.
					
					 He said Cuban authorities are concerned over the possibility that a decision of this nature could be taken in a country so geographically close to the Caribbean island nation.

articles.title: Venezuela Condemns US Human Trafficking Report
articles.content:
Venezuela Condemns US Human Trafficking Report 
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Venezuela has condemned a U.S. State Department report that lists the country among those failing to combat human trafficking.
					 Venezuela's Foreign Ministry said this in a statement Tuesday.
					
					 The Foreign Ministry said President Hugo Chavez's government "repudiates the hypocritical attitude of the government of the United States."
					
					 "That country holds the world record of trafficking in people, especially people from Latin America whose fundamental rights are violated systematically by authorities," the Foreign Ministry said.

articles.title: Kenya Plans to Introduce Environmental Science in Schools
articles.content:
Kenya Plans to Introduce Environmental Science in Schools
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kenya is taking steps to protect environment.
					 The country has recently planned to introduce environmental studies in the primary and secondary school curriculums.
					
					 It is conducting a campaign to recover and reuse waste. This is aimed to create awareness and sensitize Kenyans on solid waste management.

articles.title: Three More US Soldiers Killed in Iraq
articles.content:
Three More US Soldiers Killed in Iraq
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Three American soldiers were killed in southern Iraq Thursday.
					 The death toll of the U.S. soldiers in Iraq is on the increase due to the military operations of the resistance forces in Iraq.

articles.title: Latin American Countries Boost Cooperation
articles.content:
Latin American Countries Boost Cooperation 
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Uruguay said on Wednesday that it has signed an agreement with Paraguay to boost bilateral cooperation on cultural heritage protection.
					 On the same day the Colombian and Peruvian presidents agreed to boost bilateral cooperation in the economic, military, security and social fields. They also agreed to boost cooperation in fighting drug-smuggling.

articles.title: Food Crisis Affects Over 10 Million in East Africa
articles.content:
Food Crisis Affects Over 10 Million in East Africa
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A food crisis triggered by severe drought and high prices threatens the livelihoods of over 10 million people in East Africa, a U.N. agency said Tuesday.
					 The drought led to a sharp fall in agricultural output. As a result, food prices have soared.
					
					 The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs reported a 30 to 80 percent rise in grain prices in Kenya, and a nearly 41 percent increase in Ethiopia.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il disfruta la función artística de esposas de militares
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il disfruta la función artística de esposas de militares
						
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente   Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, vio la función de los grupos artísticos de las esposas de oficiales de las unidades 10215 y 963 del EPC y de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea, que participan en el 4º concurso del segundo período de los grupos de ese tipo del EPC.
					  En el repertorio estuvieron la narración acompañada de canciones "Nuestro líder inolvidable", el coro "No envidiamos nada a nadie en el mundo", el monólogo "Deseo", la poesía de agitación "Vivimos en medio de enfrentamientos", el coro "Gloria a nuestro gran partido" y otras piezas de diferentes géneros.
					
					  En la ocasión, las ejecutantes cantaron en tono emocionante del gran orgullo y la vida optimista y digna de ellas que han crecido como revolucionarias que acatan en la primera línea la dirección del Songun del partido.
					
					  Igualmente, manifestaron el indoblegable temperamento y la férrea voluntad de las esposas de oficiales de defender a ultranza a la Dirección de la Revolución y cumplir sin falta la causa revolucionaria del Juche situándose en la misma trinchera con sus esposos uniformados.
					
					  Los espectadores enviaron fuertes aplausos a las ejecutantes, conocidas como segundas trompeteras de la era del Songun, quienes con su función de alto nivel ideo-artístico, inyectan en todos los militares y civiles la determinación de defender a costa de la vida al líder y la patria, el odio y revanchismo multiplicados contra los fanáticos de enfrentamiento.
					
					  Terminada la función, el Dirigente felicitó a las ejecutantes por la exitosa función respondiendo afablemente a las aclamaciones de ellas y espectadores.
					
					  Expresó el agradecimiento especial a las ejecutantes mostrándose muy satisfecho de que ellas hayan ofrecido esa función perfecta en lo ideo-artístico con las piezas de gran valor cognoscitivo y educativo que describen verazmente la vida digna y orgullosa de ellas y dan respuestas a los importantes problemas surgidos en la lucha y la vida de los hombres de la era del Songun.
					
					  La función de los grupos artísticos de las esposas de oficiales de las Unidades 10215 y 963 del EPC, participantes en el 4º concurso del segundo período de los mismos grupos, es muy sensible a lo que exigen las políticas del partido y da respuestas excelentes a los actuales problemas sociopolíticos, reiteró y propuso personalmente otorgar al espectáculo el premio especial instituido para el citado concurso.
					
					  El monólogo "Deseo" y las demás piezas, en que actúan las integrantes de la Unidad 963, conmueven e impresionan mucho al público, dijo y agregó que eso ha sido posible porque los creadores y las miembros de círculos artísticos trabajaron palpando las realidades de la época y compenetrándose en la vida agitada.
					
					  Evaluó altamente al escritor Kim Kwon Il y a la miembro Paek Ryon Hui quienes realizaron méritos especiales en la creación y la interpretación de las piezas de función.
					
					  Exhortó a toda la sociedad a aprender el ejemplo de las esposas de oficiales, destacando que son magníficos el mundo espiritual y el modo de trabajo y vida de ellas que viven de modo combativo con la fe y optimismo del futuro.
					
					  El 4º concurso del segundo período volvió a patentizar la justeza y la vitalidad de la orientación del partido sobre la literatura y el arte, específicamente, de la masificación de actividades artísticas, y la orgullosa fisonomía de la nueva cultura creada en la época del Songun, apuntó.
					
					  A continuación, indicó las tareas programáticas que servirán de directiva en dinamizar las actividades culturales y artísticas masivas.
					
					  Acompañaron al Dirigente en esta ocasión los cuadros directivos de las instituciones del partido y las fuerzas armadas: Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, U Tong Chuk, Kim Chang Sop y Ri Myong Su, los miembros de la Comisión Militar Central del PTC, Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yong Chol y Yun Jong Rin, y el jefe de departamento del CDN, Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a Hugo Chávez Frías
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a Hugo Chávez Frías
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, envió el día primero un mensaje de felicitación al presidente de la República Bolivariana  de Venezuela, Hugo Chávez Frías, con motivo del bicentenario de la independencia de este país.
					En la misiva, el remitente señala que se siente alegre el hecho de que bajo la dirección del presidente el amistoso pueblo venezolano lograra notables éxitos en defender con firmeza  la independencia y la soberanía del país y construir una sociedad justa para las masas trabajadoras.
					
					Envía irrestricto apoyo y solidaridad con las iniciativas y los esfuerzos del gobierno venezolano por la integración regional y el desarrollo independiente.
					
					Convencido de  que las relaciones de amistad y cooperación entre los pueblos de ambos países seguirán desarrollándose favorablemente también en el futuro en el único camino para la independencia antiimperialista y el socialismo, el remitente le desea de todo corazón al destinatario buena salud y mayores éxitos en sus trabajos para la prosperidad del país y el bienestar del pueblo.

articles.title: Mitin capitalino del ejército y pueblo denuncia a Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Mitin capitalino del ejército y pueblo denuncia a Lee Myung Bak
						
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el día 4 en la capitalina Plaza Kim Il Sung un mitin del ejército y el pueblo en señal de denuncia a los crímenes de la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak.
					Asistieron allí los cuadros directivos del Partido, el Estado y el ejército, el presidente de partido amigo, funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, entidades sociales, ministerios y órganos centrales,  oficiales y soldados del Ejército Popular de Corea y de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea,  funcionarios de los sectores de ciencia, educación, cultura y arte, salud pública, prensa e información junto con más de 100 mil trabajadores, jóvenes y estudiantes en esta capital. 
					
					En la ocasión se dio lectura a la declaración del portavoz de la Comandancia Suprema del Ejército Popular de Corea y hubo discursos.
					
					El general del EPC y delegado del EPC, Jang Jong Nam,  al hacer uso de la palabra dijo:
					
					Dado que los maniacos conflictivos surcoreanos se atreven a hacer provocaciones de desatar hasta la guerra, queda sólo el balance físico de fuego entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					
					El poderoso ejército revolucionario del monte Paektu no dice palabras huecas sino cumple si se decide y asestará demoledores golpes a los provocadores, lo que es el ímpetu y audacia del EPC.
					
					Quienes ofendan en lo mínimo la máxima dignidad de la RPDC no sobrevivirán en esta tierra.
					
					El delegado de la juventud y estudiantes, Ri Yong Chol, primer secretario del Comité Central de la Unión de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, subrayó que los imprudentes actos conflictivos del traidor Lee Myung Bak y los gangsters militares consternan al mundo, y expresó vehemente indignación a este monstruoso enemigo en nombre de los 5 millones de jóvenes y estudiantes.
					
					Todos los jóvenes y estudiantes aniquilarán sin piedad a los traidores en la delantera de la sagrada lucha pannacional de represalia como el destacamento de combate de reserva y el cuerpo de misión especial del Comandante Supremo y lograrán a toda costa la causa de la reunificación de la patria, aseveró.
					
					El delegado de la clase obrera, Kim Ho Chol, efe de galería de la Mina de Carbón de Hukryong, apuntó que en los corazones de los obreros coreanos arden de odio y venganza a la banda de títeres surcoreanos, que actúan frenéticamente a la campaña de confrontación anti-RPDC y añadió que los obreros frustrarán rotundamente las imprudentes campañas conflictivas anti-RPDC de la banda del traidor Lee con el aumento productivo en todos los sectores de la economía nacional.
					
					La delegada de trabajadores agrícolas, Kim Yong Bok, presidenta de la Junta Administrativa de la Granja Especializada de Verduras del capitalino municipio de Mangyongdae, aseveró que si no castigan a los traidores, la nación coreana sufrirá mayores  calamidades.
					
					Los trabajadores agrícolas defenderán firmemente el campo rural socialista tomando en una mano el fusil y en la otra la hoz y registrarán un cambio decisivo en la producción agrícola con el sentimiento de  asestar el golpe de represalia al traidor Lee.

articles.title: Jefe de delegación coreana aboga por  la seguridad mundial de alimentos
articles.content:
Jefe de delegación coreana aboga por  la seguridad mundial de alimentos
						
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ATCC) -- Al hacer uso de la palabra el 29 de junio en la 37ª reunión de la asamblea general de la Organización de las Naciones Unidas para la Alimentación y la Agricultura (FAO), el jefe de la delegación de la República Popular Democrática de Corea subrayó que el gobierno de la RPDC intensificará también en el futuro la cooperación con la FAO y todos sus miembros países según el ideal de la política exterior basada en la independencia, la paz y la amistad y contribuirá activamente a los esfuerzos internacionales por garantizar la seguridad de los alimentos del mundo.
					Evaluó que en el pasado, la FAO logró una serie de éxitos en los trabajos para la seguridad de alimentos y el desarrollo multilateral de la agricultura en escala mundial y ejerce su capacidad directriz en hacer frente eficaz a los desafíos de amenaza a la existencia de la humanidad.
					
					La crisis de alimentos causada por los desastres naturales que azotan el mundo, la subida repentina de los precios de alimentos y petróleo, el aumento de la producción de combustibles biológicos, etc. exige las medias más activas en las actividades de la FAO para alcanzar la seguridad de alimentos en la escala mundial, recalcó.
					
					Subrayó que la FAO tendrá que prestar atención a preparar el ambiente internacional favorable a que se aseguren las condiciones socio-económicas para elevar la capacidad de producción agrícola de los países en vías de desarrollo y a hacer que los miembros países tracen la estrategia y política agrícolas conforme a sus propias situaciones y tomen las medidas para elevar la capacidad de producción agrícola.
					
					La RPDC definió la agricultura como cordón umbilical de la solución del problema de vida del pueblo y concentra todas las fuerzas estatales al respecto, destacó y concluyó que los esfuerzos de la RPDC por la construcción económica contribuirán al desarrollo de economía mundial y la seguridad de alimentos y será una contribución significativa a los esfuerzos de la sociedad internacional por la conquista de las metas de desarrollo de milenio de la ONU y el cumplimento del proyecto de acción de la cumbre para la seguridad de alimentos del mundo.

articles.title: Concluye con éxito la gira del grupo de Taekwon-do por EE.UU.
articles.content:
Concluye con éxito la gira del grupo de Taekwon-do por EE.UU. 
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ATCC) -- Se ha levantado una vez más en Estados Unidos la oleada de Taekwon-do, arte marcial ortodoxo de la nación coreana que se divulga ampliamente hoy en escala mundial.
					  El grupo de demostración de Taekwon-do de la RPDC concluyó su segunda gira por 3 ciudades orientales de EE.UU. como Nueva York, la cual duró una semana desde el pasado 9 de junio.
					
					  La primera gira del mismo grupo tuvo lugar en el 96 (2007) de la Era Juche produciendo grandes repercusiones en el territorio estadounidense.
					
					  La presente gira centró gran atención del mundo porque coincidió con que la República Popular Democrática de Corea refuerza el intercambio y la cooperación internacionales bajo la bandera de independencia, paz y amistad impulsando a la vez la construcción de una gran potencia próspera socialista.
					
					  Los medios de prensa de muchos países, como EE.UU. y China, dieron cobertura total al viaje del grupo coreano a EE.UU. desde su partida de Pyongyang hasta su arribo al destino, actuación y regreso, destacando la importancia de esta visita.
					
					  Era muy grande la esperanza de los ciudadanos norteamericanos cifrada en los "embajadores" deportivos de la RPDC que unirían los corazones del pueblo coreano y el norteamericano demostrando el poderío de Taekwon-do, reconocido como uno de los excelentes artes marciales del mundo siendo orgullo de la nación coreana.
					
					  En las sedes habilitadas para la demostración flameaba la bandera nacional de la RPDC de color azul marino y rojo y estaban pegadas las pancartas "Visita de amistad del grupo de demostración de Taekwon-do de la RPDC-2011" y "RPDC-EE.UU. - reconciliación, amistad y paz", además de ser abarrotadas de aficionados, ciudadanos y coreanos que residen en diferentes localidades de EE.UU.
					
					  Los taekwondocas coreanos iniciaron su demostración en Boston, capital del estado Massachussets, y estremecieron el territorio norteamericano con sólo 3 actuaciones modelo poniendo de relieve la inteligencia y el indoblegable ímpetu de la nación coreana.
					
					  En esas ocasiones, inauguradas con la izada de la bandera nacional de la RPDC y la interpretación de su himno nacional, ellos cumplieron magníficamente todos los movimientos, inclusive el Taekwon-do para la salud, dando muestras de su alto nivel técnico.
					
					  Cada vez que ellos mostraban refinadas acciones técnicas como la quiebra de objetos, la patada con salto mortal y las habilidades de autodefensa, estallaban en la audiencia los aplausos y las aclamaciones de los espectadores ya en pie.
					
					  La ovación no interrumpía aun después de terminada la demostración y los espectadores no regresaban sin felicitar a los taekwondocas visitantes y tomar fotos o firmas de éstos.
					
					Los espectadores dijeron al unísono que la representación modelo les hizo saber cuán fuerte es el espíritu de Corea, admirado por el mundo, calificando el Taekwon-do coreano de arte marcial más maravilloso y misterioso. 
					
					Los coreanos residentes en EE.UU. confesaron que se sintieron más orgullosos de ser descendientes de Corea, patria de Taekwon-do, al ver la demostración en que palpitan el espíritu y el ímpetu de la nación coreana.
					
					Además de su indoblegable espíritu, valentía y alta tecnología, los jugadores coreanos conmovieron al público con sus nobles cualidades morales.
					
					Ante los periodistas que felicitaban los éxitos de la representación, los taekwondocas coreanos dijeron en tono orgulloso que realizaron su actuación modelo con la audacia y el coraje que les ha inspirado el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Al escuchar tales palabras y sentir la fe absoluta y la añoranza de los coreanos a su líder, los ciudadanos norteamericanos dijeron entre sorpresa y asentimiento que pudieron tener una profunda comprensión de la fuente de la fuerza espiritual de la RPDC. 
					
					Durante la gira, el grupo de demostración de Taekwon-do enseñó los movimientos de este deporte a los alumnos de escuelas secundarias y primarias de varias ciudades de EE.UU.
					
					Un periodista norteamericano, que daba cobertura al grupo, señaló que la presencia del grupo coreano en EE.UU. trajo la subida de la popularidad de Taekwon-do y prosiguió:
					
					Taekwon-do es más popular que Karate, Kungfu y otros artes marciales porque permite forjar no sólo la constitución física sino también la mente. Muchos padres de EE.UU. enseñan a sus hijos Taekwon-do porque esta disciplina exige más la formación espiritual y humana que otros artes marciales. Ellos esperan que a través del entrenamiento de Taekwon-do, sus hijos aprendan la paciencia, la concentración, las acciones disciplinadas, el respeto a los mayores, la responsabilidad, el abstencionismo de bebidas alcohólicas y cigarros, etc.
					
					Los medios de prensa de EE.UU. y el mundo reportaron diariamente bajo grandes titulares en sus planos y pantallas la actuación modelo del grupo coreano en EE.UU.
					
					CNN y otras cadenas radiales y periódicos norteamericanos, el periódico de los coreanos residentes en EE.UU., los medios de Internet, la CCTV, la Nihon TV, "KBS", "MBC" y otros medios surcoreanos informaron intensamente los éxitos de representación y las noticias de permanencia del grupo de demostración de Taekwon-do.
					
					VOA realizó casi todos los días el reportaje especial de la visita del grupo coreano.
					
					Los medios de prensa de EE.UU. reportaron que los estadounidenses, que miraban con curiosidad a los jugadores coreanos, ya se confundían con éstos imitando sus movimientos de Taekwon-do.
					
					  Hasta los políticos norteamericanos evaluaron el éxito y el significado de la gira enviando cartas de felicitación.
					
					  El presidente del comité de relaciones exteriores del Senado norteamericano dijo que el intercambio cultural de este año contribuirá al fomento de reconciliación, amistad y paz entre los dos países.
					
					  Un representante del Congreso por New Jersey dio bienvenida al intercambio de ese tipo, asegurando que la actuación del grupo de demostración de Taekwon-do en EE.UU. formará las relaciones basadas en la comprensión entre el pueblo estadounidense y el coreano.
					
					  El alcalde de una ciudad del estado New Jersey, en su carta congratulatoria, señaló que el Taekwon-do coreano es muy distinto a los artes marciales estrenados anteriormente en EE.UU., citando como ejemplo la increíble unanimidad de los miembros del grupo de demostración.
					
					  Prosiguió que el grupo coreano puede estrechar las relaciones entre los pueblos de ambos países.
					
					  En la misiva a nombre común, los presidentes del senado y la cámara de representantes de New Jersey felicitaron los éxitos del grupo visitante, destacando que sus miembros son respetados y admirados por los norteamericanos por sus excepcionales talentos, altas tecnologías e ingentes esfuerzos.
					
					  Los ciudadanos de diferentes sectores de EE.UU. pidieron encarecidamente al grupo coreano que extendiera la representación a otros lugares y repitiera la visita.
					
					  Los taekwondocas coreanos aceptaron con mucho gusto esa petición diciendo que no perderían la oportunidad de volver a demostrar en EE.UU. el Taekwon-do coreano.
					
					  La oleada de Taekwon-do, levantada por ellos, ha dejado una profunda estela de sensaciones en el pueblo norteamericano.
